JavaScript: Part 1

Question:

Sample 1 below contains a JavaScript implementation of a basic Component class, with an instantiation of it. Unfortunately, it doesn't work; list any errors or problems that are preventing it from successfully running. 

            var Component = function (config) {
                for (property in config) {
                    this[propety] = config[property]
                }
            }
            var list = Array (
                "Item 1",
                "Item 2",
                "Item 3",
            )
            var instance = Component(id: "XF-254", list: list);

Answers:

  1.                 var list = new Array

    Missing 'new' on the Array declaration. (Added)

  2.                 var list = new Array (
                    "Item 1",
                    "Item 2",
                    "Item 3"
                );

    Trailing comma in array instantiation. (Removed)

    Missing semicolon at the end of array instantiation. (Added)

  3.                 var instance = Component({id: "XF-254", list: list});

    The Component constructor function is missing the curly braces as it is expecting an object literal. (Added) 

  4.                 for (property in config) {
                    this[property] = config[property]
                }

    Spelling mistake 'propety'. It should be 'property'. (Corrected)

  5.                 var instance = new Component({id: "XF-254", list: list});

    'new' missing when trying to instantiate an instance of Component. (Added)

  6. Completed:

                var Component = function (config) {
                for (property in config) {
                    this[property] = config[property]
                }
            }
            var list = new Array (
                "Item 1",
                "Item 2",
                "Item 3"
            );
            var instance = new Component({id: "XF-254", list: list});
